content.title: Basic Agriculture Training Centre Scheme
content.details: The “Basic Agriculture Training Centre Scheme” is a State Plan Scheme, which is implemented by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya. The objective of the scheme is to provide short-term vocational training for rural educated unemployed youths in agriculture and allied sectors to develop entrepreneurship skills and employment generation.
benefits: Free short-term training to educated unemployed rural youths.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Meghalaya.
The applicant should be an unemployed rural youth.
The applicant should have passed Class X.
The applicant should be interested in starting farm-based activities.
The applicant should have owned or leased agricultural land.
content.application_process: The eligible Educated Rural Youths can apply/write an application on plain paper. Along with the application, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Submit the duly filled and signed application along with the relevant documents at the office of the Principal, Basic Agricultural Training Centre (BATC). The selection procedure is based on merit and on the condition that applicants own agricultural land on which they can start their farm-based activities.
documents_required: Bank Pass Book, copy of the first page of the trainee's own functional Bank Savings Account
Two (2) Number of Passport size photographs & 1(one) Stamp Size photograph.
Medical fitness certificate from respective PHC/CHC (Original)

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The key objective is to provide short-term vocational training for rural educated unemployed youths in agriculture and allied sectors to develop entrepreneurship skills and employment generation.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Class X passed unemployed rural youths who own or have leased agricultural land and who are interested in starting farm-based activities for their livelihood.

faqs.question: What is the type of assistance/entitlement?
faqs.answer: I) Stipend @ ₹500/- per participant per month ii) Seed money @ ₹10,000/- per participant.

faqs.question: How to apply for the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Educated rural youths can apply in plain paper to Principal, BATC.

faqs.question: What is the beneficiaries’ selection procedure?
faqs.answer: The selection procedure is based on merit and on the condition that applicants own agriculture land on which they can start their farm-based activities.
